page.title: 03A COUNTRY PUB
page.content: This is pub, is on a remote road some way from King's Caple, the nearest village. It is run by a man and his wife from Yorkshire, who came here 4 years ago because they liked the area, the climate, and the way of life of the people who live here. At lunch-time there are few customers, but in the evening they have about 10. At weekends they get up to 24. They keep pigs, cattle and poultry, some to sell and some for themselves. They also have a site for 5 caravans, registered with the Caravan Club. The regular customers are mostly the older men, farmers and gardeners, very old fashioned, and "are real characters". If they want to tell a naughty story, they send the landlady into the kitchen. The younger men go to discos in Hereford, but start drinking here when they get married.
